method.name: Subgroup Discovery Iterative Genetic Algorithmss

reference.ref: M.J. del Jesus, P. Gonzalez, F. Herrera, M. Mesonero, Evolutionary Fuzzy Rule Induction Process for Subgroup Discovery: A case study in marketing, IEEE Transactions on Fuzzy Systems, 15 (4), pp. 578-592, 2007.

generalDescription.objective: To obtain Fuzzy Rules to describe data

parameterSpec.param: nLabels: Number of labels for continuous variables.
nEval: Number of evaluations in the evolutionary algorithm.
minCnf: Value of the minimum confidence to filter the rules
lSearch: This parameter indicates if the algorithm uses or not local search
Obj1: Objective number ONE. The user can be chosen between different supports: Support based on the examples of the class (COMP), Crisp Support (CSUP) and Fuzzy Support (FSUP).
Obj2: Objective number TWO. The user can be chosen between different confidence: Crisp Confidence (CCNF) and Fuzzy Confidence (FCNF).
Obj3: Objective number THREE. The user can be chosen NULL to indicate the absence of this objective or between: Coverage (COVE), Accuracy (ACCU), Significance (SIGN) and Unusualness (UNUS).
w1: Weight for the Obj1. It is a value between 0.0 and 1.0
w2: Weight for the Obj2. It is a value between 0.0 and 1.0
w3: Weight for the Obj3. It is a value between 0.0 and 1.0

method.example:

RULE FILE ========= GENERATED RULE 0 Antecedent Variable petalLength = Label 0 (-1.95 1.0 3.95) Variable petalWidth = Label 0 (-1.1 0.1 1.3000001) Consecuent: Iris-setosa
GENERATED RULE 0 Antecedent Variable petalLength = Label 1 (1.0 3.95 6.9) Variable petalWidth = Label 1 (0.1 1.3000001 2.5) Consecuent: Iris-versicolor
GENERATED RULE 0 Antecedent Variable petalWidth = Label 2 (1.3000001 2.5 3.7) Consecuent: Iris-virginica
MEASURE FILE OF THE RULE IN TRAINING FILE =========================================
Measures used as objectives: COMP, FCNF, UNUS; Class COMP FCNF UNUS FITNESS 0 1,000000 0,971526 0,555556 0,858125 1 1,000000 0,670049 0,530864 0,760274 2 1,000000 0,904255 0,466667 0,811277
TRACKING FILE =============
-------------------------------------------- | Parameters Echo | -------------------------------------------- Algorithm name: sdiga Input file name training: ../datasets/iris/iris-10-1tra.dat Input file name test: ../datasets/iris/iris-10-1tra.dat Rules file name: ../results/sdiga.iris/result0e0.txt Tracking file name: ../results/sdiga.iris/result0e2.txt Random generator seed: 0 Selected class of the target variable: not established Number of labels for the continuous variables: 3 Number of evaluations: 10000 Number of individuals in the Population: 100 Cross probability: 0.6 Mutation probability: 0.01 Minimum confidence: 0.6 Rules representation: CAN Objective 1: COMP(Weight: 0.4) Objective 2: FCNF(Weight: 0.3) Objective 3: UNUS(Weight: 0.3) Perform Local Search: true
-------------------------------------------- | Semantics for the continuous variables | -------------------------------------------- Fuzzy sets parameters for variable sepalLength: Label 0: 2.5000002 4.3 6.1000004 Label 1: 4.3 6.1000004 7.9 Label 2: 6.1000004 7.9 9.7 Fuzzy sets parameters for variable sepalWidth: Label 0: 0.79999995 2.0 3.2 Label 1: 2.0 3.2 4.4 Label 2: 3.2 4.4 5.6000004 Fuzzy sets parameters for variable petalLength: Label 0: -1.95 1.0 3.95 Label 1: 1.0 3.95 6.9 Label 2: 3.95 6.9 9.85 Fuzzy sets parameters for variable petalWidth: Label 0: -1.1 0.1 1.3000001 Label 1: 0.1 1.3000001 2.5 Label 2: 1.3000001 2.5 3.7
-------------------------------------------- | Dataset Echo | -------------------------------------------- Number of examples: 135 Number of variables: 4 @relation .a/iris/iris @attribute sepalLength real [4.3, 7.9] @attribute sepalWidth real [2.0, 4.4] @attribute petalLength real [1.0, 6.9] @attribute petalWidth real [0.1, 2.5] @attribute class {Iris-setosa, Iris-versicolor, Iris-virginica} @inputs sepalLength, sepalWidth, petalLength, petalWidth @outputs class

-------------------------------------------- | Execution results | --------------------------------------------
